title: Local Govt. Week to commence today with ‘City of Renaissance’ theme
byline: The Local Government Week, aimed at creating a “City of Renaissance,” is set to commence today (15).

title: Qatar PM urges world to ‘stop using double standards’ and punish Israel
byline: Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani urged the international community on Sunday (Sep 14) to “stop using double standards” and punish Israel for what he described as its “crimes”.

title: 21-year-old woman arrested for defacing Sigiriya Mirror Wall
byline: A young woman accused of defacing the World Heritage Site of the Sigiriya Mirror Wall (Kedapath Pavura) was arrested by the Sigiriya Police yesterday (14).

title: Renovation of Pettah Central Bus Stand under President’s patronage today
byline: The renovation of the Pettah Central Bus Stand is scheduled to commence this morning (15) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara Eliya districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump heads for historic second UK state visit
byline: Donald Trump will get the red carpet treatment this week on an unprecedented second United Kingdom state visit, as Britain counts on royal pomp and circumstance to woo the unpredictable United States president.

title: ‘Adolescence’ star Owen Cooper makes Emmys history as youngest-ever male winner in any acting category
byline: Adolescence breakout Owen Cooper has made history as the youngest-ever male Emmy winner in any acting category during Sunday’s 2025 Emmys.

title: Group arrested for illegal excavation of artifacts in two areas
byline: The police have arrested a group of individuals involved in the illegal excavation of artifacts at two separate locations in the country.

title: CEB workers to intensify strike action effective today
byline: All trade unions of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have announced that they will intensify their strike action against the proposed division of the CEB into four parts, effective today (15).

title: 11-year old boy drowns in Dewahuwa Reservoir
byline: An 11-year-old boy has reportedly drowned while bathing in the Dewahuwa Reservoir in the Galewela area, police said.

title: Hollywood celebrates ‘The Pitt’ and ‘The Studio’ at TV’s Emmy Awards
byline: Emergency room saga “The Pitt” was toasted as the year’s best television drama, and show-business satire “The Studio” was crowned best comedy, as Hollywood stars handed out trophies at the annual Emmy Awards on Sunday.

title: Israel intensifies Gaza City bombing as Rubio arrives
byline: Israeli forces destroyed at least 30 residential buildings in Gaza City and forced thousands of people from their homes, Palestinian officials said, as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio arrived on Sunday (Sep 14) to discuss the future of the conflict.

title: Govt’s objective is to reduce prison population– Justice Minister
byline: The government’s objective is to reduce the number of people imprisoned in the country, the Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara says.

title: Rising oceans to threaten 1.5 million Australians by 2050: Report
byline: Rising oceans and flooding caused by climate change will threaten the homes and livelihoods of over a million Australians by 2050, while deaths from heat-related illness will soar, a landmark report warned Monday (Sep 15) ahead of the country’s releasing its emission reduction targets this week.

title: Case against former Minister Keheliya and family members adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court today (15) ordered the case filed against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife, three daughters, and son-in-law, over allegations of illegally acquired assets, to be recalled on October 01.

title: Former army soldier arrested with elephant tusks in Moragoda
byline: A retired army soldier was arrested while in possession of a pair of elephant tusks during an operation conducted by officers at the Moragoda Police Station.

title: Govt aims to build independent and people-oriented police service - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that it is the Government’s expectation to transform the Police Service into an independent, efficient, friendly, and people-oriented service.

title: Renovation of Pettah Central Bus Stand inaugurated under President’s patronage
byline: The inauguration ceremony for the renovation of the Pettah Central Bus Stand has officially commenced this morning (15).

title: Musk’s Starlink service back up after brief outage affects thousands of users
byline: Elon Musk’s satellite internet service Starlink was back online for most users after a brief outage on Monday, according to tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: UK and US to announce tech, energy deals during Trump visit
byline: The United States and Britain will announce agreements on technology and civil nuclear energy during U.S. President Donald Trump’s unprecedented second state visit this week, as the UK hopes to finalise steel tariffs under a much-vaunted trade deal.

title: Renovation of Maradana Railway Station launched under Dream Destination program
byline: The renovation of the Maradana Railway Station, under the government’s “Clean Sri Lanka” and “Dream Destination” initiatives, was officially launched this morning (15) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Officer attached to Galle Housing Development Authority office arrested on bribery charges
byline: A Technical Officer attached to the Galle office of the National Housing Development Authority has been arrested on bribery charges.

title: No revision in controlled prices despite rice shortage: CAA
byline: The Chairman of the Consumer Affairs Authority, Hemanta Samarakoon says the CAA has received information regarding the shortage of rice in the market.

title: UN Rights Council to debate Israel attack on Qatar Tuesday
byline: The United Nations Human Rights Council said it would host an urgent debate on Tuesday on Israel’s airstrike targeting Hamas leaders in Qatar.

title: SC to hear petition against former Navy Commander Wasantha Karannagoda in Jan.
byline: The Supreme Court today granted permission to hear an appeal petition filed by the parents of 11 youth who were allegedly abducted and disappeared, requesting that the decision made by the Attorney General to remove former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy Wasantha Karannagoda—who was named as a suspect in the related case—be declared invalid.

title: New Nepal interim ministers sworn in after protests
byline: Nepal’s new interim prime minister unveiled her first ministers on Monday (Sep 15), as the Himalayan nation seeks to restore order after deadly youth-led anti-corruption protests that ousted the previous government.

title: Rs. 2000 currency note will be gradually introduced into the banking system: CBSL
byline: The newly issued Rs. 2000 commemorative currency note, released on 29 August 2025 to mark its 75th anniversary, will be gradually introduced into the banking system, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has announced.

title: Youth arrested for defacing Sigiriya Mirror Wall remanded
byline: A youth, who was arrested for allegedly defacing the World Heritage Site of the Sigiriya Mirror Wall (Kedapath Pavura) by the Sigiriya Police yesterday (14), has been remanded.

title: Sampath Manamperi informs willingness to surrender to court  through attorneys
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who is reportedly wanted in connection with ongoing legal proceedings, has notified authorities of his willingness to surrender to court.

title: Another suspected ‘Ice’ production facility uncovered in Hambantota
byline: Another house believed to have been used by underworld figures ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and ‘Kudu Nilanga’ for manufacturing the drug ‘Ice’ has been uncovered in Mayurapura, Hambantota by the Kalutara District Crimes Division.

title: Australia reports decline in HIV, surge in common STIs
byline: Australia’s 2024 sexual health report shows a concerning rise in common sexually transmitted infections (STIs) alongside a decline in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) diagnoses.

title: Four invasive ornamental fish species banned by Fisheries Ministry
byline: A gazette notification has been issued banning the import and sale of four invasive ornamental fish species by the Ministry of Fisheries, Aquatic Resources, and Ocean Resources.

title: US ‘very close’ to TikTok deal with China: US Treasury chief
byline: The United States is “very close” to a deal with China to settle their dispute over TikTok, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Monday (Sep 15) as the two sides resumed trade talks in Madrid.

title: Sri Lanka economy reports 4.9% growth in second quarter
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy grew 4.9% year-on-year in the second quarter of 2025, official data showed on Monday (15).

title: Army deployed to contain fire in ‘Nonpareil Reserve’, over 1,000 acres of land destroyed
byline:
Sri Lanka Army personnel have been deployed to help control the forest fire that broke out in the Nonpareil Reserve in Balangoda, according to Ada Derana reporter.
The fire, which has been raging for several days, is reported to have already destroyed over 1,000 acres of land.

title: Close associate of ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ detained under PTA for 90 days
byline: The Western Province North Crimes Division today informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that Devanmini Dissanayake, also known as “Pas deva”, who is currently in custody, is being detained and interrogated under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) on the orders of the Secretary to the Ministry of Defence.

title: China opposes U.S. demand for tariffs on China over Russian oil purchase
byline: China firmly opposes a U.S. demand that Group of Seven and North Atlantic Treaty Organization countries impose tariffs of 50 to 100 percent on China due to the country’s purchase of Russian oil, a spokesperson for the Ministry of Commerce said Monday.

title: US, China reach framework deal on TikTok; Trump and Xi to speak on Friday
byline: The United States and China reached a framework agreement to switch short-video app TikTok to U.S.-controlled ownership that will be confirmed in a call between President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday, U.S. officials said.

title: Report on motor capacity of BYD vehicles released expected in coming weeks: AG informs court
byline: The Attorney General informed the Court of Appeal today (15) that the report of the expert committee appointed to determine the motor capacity of BYD vehicles—which were previously detained by Sri Lanka Customs and later released on bank guarantees—is expected to be submitted in the coming weeks, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several districts including Colombo
byline: A warm weather advisory has been issued for residents of the Northern, North-central, North-western and Eastern provinces and in the Colombo, Gampaha, Hambantota and Monaragala districts.

title: World Bank commends Sri Lanka’s current economic programme
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met Johannes Zutt, the Vice President for the South Asia Region of the World Bank Group and a delegation of its representatives visiting Sri Lanka today (15) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Clinical training for final-year medical students of Moratuwa University begins at Nagoda Hospital
byline: Clinical training for final-year medical students of the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Moratuwa has officially commenced at the Kalutara Nagoda Teaching Hospital.
